properties.areaDesc: West Jackson and West Grand Counties Above 9000 Feet
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 2 at 6:00AM MST until January 2 at 12:00PM MST by NWS Denver CO
properties.description:
...SNOW AND WIND CONTINUING IN THE NORTHERN COLORADO MOUNTAINS...

.Mountain locations received snowfall amounts between 4 and 10
inches overnight as a weather disturbance continued moving across
the state. The heaviest snow fell over Rabbit Ears Pass and to the
north, while parts of Summit County weren't too far behind. More
snow is expected this morning before the storm begins moving out
of the state.  Gusty winds of 35 to 50 mph can also be expected
on mountain passes, with even higher winds in backcountry areas.
The winds will produce blowing and drifting snow with reduced
visibilities. Additional accumulations should be less than 4 to 6
inches, but travel conditions will still be hazardous due to the
combination of snow that fell overnight and anticipated additional
snowfall.

* WHAT...Snow with additional snow accumulations of 3 to 6
inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph.

* WHERE...Rabbit Ears Pass and to the north.

* WHEN...Until noon MST today.

* IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult at times, especially this
morning. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce
visibility.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1 or
visiting www.cotrip.org.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON MST TODAY
